results.title: Immunohistochemical and histomorphological analysis of rat mammary tumors after simvastatin treatment.
results.text_hl: Immunohistochemical and histomorphological analysis of @SPECIES_10116 @@@rat@@@ @<m>DISEASE_Mammary_Neoplasms_Animal</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D015674 @@@mammary tumors@@@ after @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ treatment.

citations.NLM: Kubatka P, Kajo K, Zihlavnikova K, Adamicova K, Vybohova D, Pec M, Nosal V, Stollarova N, Bojkova B, Kassayova M, Orendas P. Immunohistochemical and histomorphological analysis of rat mammary tumors after simvastatin treatment. Neoplasma. 2012;59(5):516-23. PMID: 22668016

results.title: Anti-carcinogenic activity of simvastatin during the promotion phase of radiation-induced mammary tumorigenesis of rats.
results.text_hl: The administration of dietary @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ together with @CHEMICAL_Diethylstilbestrol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004054 @@@DES@@@ treatment significantly decreased the incidence of @<m>DISEASE_Mammary_Neoplasms_Animal</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D015674 @@@mammary tumours@@@.

citations.NLM: Inano H, Suzuki K, Onoda M, Wakabayashi K. Anti-carcinogenic activity of simvastatin during the promotion phase of radiation-induced mammary tumorigenesis of rats. Carcinogenesis. 1997 Sep;18(9):1723-7. PMID: 9328167
citations.BibTeX: @article{9328167, title={Anti-carcinogenic activity of simvastatin during the promotion phase of radiation-induced mammary tumorigenesis of rats.}, author={Inano H and Suzuki K and Onoda M and Wakabayashi K}, journal={Carcinogenesis}, volume={18}, number={9}, pages={1723-7}}

results.title: Proliferation of human mammary cancer cells exposed to 27-hydroxycholesterol.
results.text_hl: In @GENE_ESR1 @GENE_2099 @@@ER@@@-positive @<m>DISEASE_Mammary_Neoplasms_Animal</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D015674 @@@mammary tumor@@@ cells, we detected the blocking of 27OHC proliferation-stimulatory activity by @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@, as well as the inhibition of @CHEMICAL_Estradiol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004958 @@@E(2)@@@-stimulated proliferation by an @GENE_AFP @GENE_174 @@@alpha-fetoprotein@@@-derived cyclic nonapeptide.

citations.NLM: Cruz P, Torres C, Ramírez ME, Epuñán MJ, Valladares LE, Sierralta WD. Proliferation of human mammary cancer cells exposed to 27-hydroxycholesterol. Exp Ther Med. 2010 May;1(3):531-536. PMID: 22993572
citations.BibTeX: @article{22993572, title={Proliferation of human mammary cancer cells exposed to 27-hydroxycholesterol.}, author={Cruz P and Torres C and Ramírez ME and Epuñán MJ and Valladares LE and Sierralta WD}, journal={Exp Ther Med}, volume={1}, number={3}, pages={531-536}}
